Checkin was smooth and efficient - especially since I was early.  Room was large, nice and clean.  Very niced gym!  Close to several restaurants (Rubino's and Thai and a creperie) and a Starbucks!  We had a meeting in this facility - only needed a small conf. room - and it met our needs perfectly.  Staff was great - all were very friendly and professional!  Would definitely return!
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments about the hotel and your recent stay.  I'm delighted that you found our staff friendly and helpful.  We hope to welcome you back again soon!  Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we are doing.  Your comments will be shared with our staff.  See you soon I hope!

Summary: Recently booked 3 rooms as HHonors Gold and was given upgraded rooms to top (7th) floor.  Even though most our party wasn't arriving until 10:30pm, they allowed me to come check-in early and set the rooms up.  Very friendly and accommodating staff.    Rooms were clean and good-sized.  My only complaint was that the walls or adjoining doors were not good at blocking sound.  While in our rooms we had someone from the desk come ask us to quiet down, although I know for certain we were not overly loud.  I also noticed that there were room service trays and trash remaining in the hallways outside the rooms for quite a few (6-7) hours.  The hotel is fairly small, and almost has a boutique feel.  Breakfast in the morning at the Bordeaux was great and had very good food. (Although the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: I stayed one night at this very clean hotel in a great location for our wine business meetings in April.  My room was spacious with one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in and it was immaculately clean with a nice view of the city from the 4th floor.  The little things make a big difference and I appreciate the famous warm cookie on arrival, the High Definition TV, and the compact Wolfgang Puck coffee maker that brewed a strong cup of java in the morning. I also appreciated that there was no charge to park my vehicle in the underground parking garage.  Instead of fighting Friday traffic to drive 3 hours home I will continue to use this excellent hotel in the future and highly recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: NOT A GOOD DEAL FOR BUSINESS TRAVELERS
Summary: Most hotels that cater to business travelers include a free breakfast, free coffee in the lobby or eating area, and free Wi-Fi. Not this hotel. PAY, PAY, PAY for everything -- and it's overpriced. My husband and I won't stay at a Doubletree for business travel anytime soon.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with some strange quirks.......
Summary: This is a fairly new hotel that is in a good location just off of the 55 freeway. It has nice, compact rooms and a fresh feel to it. The hotel is generally run well and the restaurant is very nice and inviting.  There are several quirks that stop me from booking this hotel in the future: 1) As noted by others, the parking is split between a small lot in front of the hotel and an underground lot behind the hotel. They over charge for parking and put a red sticker on your car if you don't place their parking permit in your car quickly (very poor customer management). 2) It can have one of the busiest and noisiest lobbies as they pack in events that fill and disperse through the main walkway to the elevators. 3) They do not seem to employ an upgrade strategy of any type for elite
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: Stayed here for a volleyball tournament in mid March 2012.  Staff was great... rooms were comfortable.  Restaurant bar had amazingly good buffet breakfast every morning.  And at night, the bartender was very friendly (drinks were expensive, but they always are at hotels).
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: This hotel is fantastic.  I had a room on the top floor.  Modern decor, which was warm and inviting.  Very clean.  Comfortable beds.  Everything about my hotel experience was fantastic, except that the shower water temperature never got as hot as I would expect.  It was warm water, but was abnormally lacking "hot" water.  That is my only reason for not making this 5 stars.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: Nice but it has some flaws
Summary: It is a nice hotel with free parking underneath.  The lobby has a big problem as they host many business events with large group.  Typically, the large eveing crowd doing a reception would typically occupy the public space between the front lobby and the elevators to the rooms.  We had to fight our way through very large and super noisy crowds to just get into our room and out to the front when we had to go out.  It is a very unpleasant experiience.  Otherwise, the room was very comfortable.  The bed was great and the housekeeping and cleanliness was excellent.  There is also a gourmet food court very near by and offer quite but excellent sit-down meals at very low cost.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel and great value on weekends
Summary: Perfect hotel close to shopping, beaches and dining.Located in business area, so quiet and affordable on weekends.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: Many of us travel frequently, and really do not look forward the luck of the draw on hotel rooms, check in, unpacking and repacking. To many things can go wrong from the front desk to the air-conditioning!  BUT....There is hope Ladies and Gentlemen....what is everything went just right??!!! That was my experience at the DT Santa Ana. Starting with the right price,  I pull in find the perfect parking, walk right into the lobby, my aching legs refreshed by a welcoming smile at the front desk, and a receptionist who cared! A room with a view, yes even in Santa Ana. The air-conditioning worked, the beds did not take a 24 hour period to get used to, the rooms were clean, and complimentary breakfast fresh, tasty and not the usual fare. WOW - Great job DT Santa Ana, I am coming back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: I stayed at this Doubletree for one night prior to flying home to the East Coast.  The hotel is very nice with comfortable rooms and a friendly staff.  They have a convenient shuttle, which allowed me to return my rental car and get a ride back to the hotel.  They took me to the airport the next morning.  My only complaint was with the internet service.  I could not get a signal either wireless or with the cable service.  Apparently, there was a technical problem.  It was available in the business center.  I am Hhonors gold so breakfast was included.  The Doubletree offers a nice hot/cold buffet in its restaurant, which was nice before the long trip home.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: Nothing special but a clean comfortable place to stay
Summary: If you are in the area and want a clean comfortable place to stay this hotel is fine.  It has no views and is not near anything but the airport and some of the major freeways which is all I needed.  There are some great hotels in the area but for the price it is hard to beat this place.  Good cookies at check in.  Nice room with comfortable bed.  Good internet service.  Polite staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel but $15 parking fee is a bit excessive
Summary: This is a very good hotel with a helpful front desk staff, nicely equipped fitness center, and a convenient location(within 3 miles) to popular places such as the Orange County airport, South Coast shopping plaza, and a wide variety of restaurants.  The guest room is a bit on the small side but is kept clean. The downside to this property is the $15 parking fee, which is excessive for a location such as this one.  Luckily the room rates for this Doubletree are usually reasonable.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: Wedding Weekend filled w/ chocolate chip cookies
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights for one of my BFFs' wedding. The wedding was taken place at this hotel. Honestly, living in Orange County for over 10 years, I didn't even know there's a hotel in this area. Since we've moved to OR/WA area recently, we had to book a hotel for that weekend. Because of bridesmaid's duties which would require me to be at the hotel by 5 AM, we opted to stay here instead of another hotel. I've never stayed at the Doubletree so I had no idea what to expect. Although I was told to expect chocolate chip cookies!  Honestly, it always boggles my mind why one chooses to be in the hospitality business if they don't understand what customer service means. We drove around in front of the hotel trying to find a parking spot or someone who works at the hotel to tell
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: This hotel was secured through bidding on priceline. I wanted a hotel near disneyland but was priced out. I got this hotel as the best price for the star rating I chose. I stayed with a friend for a conference we attended at Disneyland. We stayed for three nights.   Pros:  We got cookies from the desk at check-in.    THe room was nice, adequately large and the beds were good.   The noise level was not a problem.   The hotel does have a good view from higher floors and I enjoyed the lights at night. This hotel does have a view of the 55 freeway so this is not a beach view but the lights at night are nice.   The bathroom was large enough for roommate situation. They had back of the door hooks for hanging clothes during shower.  We did get a cork screw from the bar without a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: A nice place to stay in Santa Ana
Summary: We stayed for two nights at the Doubletree during the middle of October 2011.  It was reasonably close to Disneyland and South Coast Plaza, so the location was ideal for our trip.  It was recently renovated, so the hotel presented itself nicely.  Our room was nice and roomy.  The first night our room faced E MacArthur Blvd.  It was noisy!  You could hear each bus pull up to the nearby bus stop, hear the hydraulic mechanisms, and hear it accelerate away from the stop.  You couldn't smell it, but you could imagine the smell of the fumes driving away.  Our room was on the third floor.  Also, our room's air conditioner fan had a constant chatter.  When we complained to the front desk, they sent someone up, and he acknowledged that the fan was not functioning correctly.  The next
Manager Response: none

Summary: Chose this facility for an overnight stay on points, primarily for SNA airport shuttle service. The lobby space was lively; had a wedding in progress complete with lion dancers. My room appeared recently updated, with modern decor and a very comfortable bed.   Having an early morning appointment, I "settled" for Bordeaux, the hotel restaurant. It was completely empty, so I wasn't expecting much. But my service was impeccable, the wine selection impressive, the chef met my off-menu request for a small side salad with an gourmet presentation of accessorized wild greens, and his sea bass was among the finest I've ever tasted. There may be lots of restaurants in the area - but for guests reluctant to walk, Bordeaux is a fine alternative!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments about your recent stay with us in Santa Ana!  I was delighted to learn of your terrific dining experience in our Bordeaux Restaurant and Wine Bar!  I'll be sure to share your kind words with our culinary staff and servers!  Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay with an Excellent Bar and Bar scene
Summary: Have stayed here many times for business. Nice, clean, rooms with an occasional upgrade when available (premium status with HiltonHonors). Front desk staff is helpful. Parking is convenient.  Bar scene is excellent in the evenings. Food is better than average but there are a LOT of really nice places to go for dinner around the area. So if you are hotel-bound for any reason the bar-restaurant provide an excellent alternative for food.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel in the area
Summary: I stay here for a couple of days twice a year and it is a great place.   I normally fly into John Wayne airport, so the shuttle service is very convenient.  The staff at the reception was very helpful and check-in was smooth. As a HHoners member I get the free breakfast & internet which is great.   The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. During this stay I was on the second floor, so the view was nothing special.  Best part of this hotel is the Bourdeaux wine bar and especially the bar tender Theirry. When travelling alone or in a small group, it is a great place to enjoy an excellent glass of wine and some food. This is one of the reasons why I always come back to this place.   The breakfast in the restaurant is very good. I always go for the cooked to order omelet and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last weekend, because our friend was getting married not to far from the hotel.   Pros:  -Room was spacious. -Roberto the bartender showed awesome customer service.  -Room rate was a great price.  Cons: -Customer service was bad, besides Roberto at the restuarant.  The Front Desk, doesn't acknowledge you when you walk through the lobby. They didn't even call us when our taxi arrived to the hotel. And when I got to my room and the housekeeper was cleaning it, she didn't say one word to me. All she did was stare at me, like what do you want.  -Bar closed at 11pm. -Walls of the hotel are a bit thin, so you can hear the couple fighting next door.  -The TV was bit slow when changing channels.
Manager Response: Thank you for using Trip Advisor to post your experience from your recent stay with us.  It's important for us to know how we're doing and we take your comments seriously.  Kudos to Roberto for delivering outstanding customer service.  We'll make sure he knows that you recognized him by name!  I'm sorry that you didn't have the same kind of experience when you arrived and throughout your stay.  One of the most important things we can do is provide a warm, friendly welcome when you arrive!  Your comments and experiences will be shared with our guest services team during a training meeting on Friday so we can learn from it.  Our goal is to exceed your expections in service, attitude and delivery and I am sorry that we failed you.  We appreciate your business and hope that you will give us another chance to demonstrate outstanding customer service.  If/when your travels bring you back to this area, please call me personally so that I may handle your reservation and greet you when you arrive.  Diane Blake, General Manager

Summary: My son & his wife recently held their wedding reception at this hotel.  The service, personnel, and food were all just wonderful!  The hotel bar normally closes around 11 pm, but the bartender happily stayed to accommodate those guests who just weren't ready to call it a night after the reception.  Great job to all.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: There are two doubletree hotel in the area within 5 minutes. My family stayed in both and each for 2 nights. This one is newer and nicer than the other one. The entrance shows luxurious inside.  As for the room, it is always as nice in doubletree hotels (after the stay in DAYS INN ALAMOSA, I stay only in Best Western, Hilton, Priority Club chained hotel. DAYS INN is a ever worst chained hotel) The service in doubletree here is nice. Also, the bed are clean and comfortable.  Final thing, they always offer free hot cookies! For gold elite member like me, they always  provide buffet breakfast and free drinks. If you don't have a elite membership, just book a breakfast included room. It's a good buffet breakfast there =)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: We stayed at the Double Tree in Santa Ana and what a great hotel and staff.  The beds were great, rooms were very clean and hotel staff was super!  Great places to stay and very close to everything in Orange County!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: Pros:  Clean, comfortable bed and good sheets/linens, good size room, good service/staff, freeway access, free parking the week I was there, carpets clean Cons:  Pool very small, hot tub water not real clear, fitness room small, internet charge, elevators are slow, avoid adjoining rooms the doors are paper thin, shower water noise from above was loud
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: Large  comfortable rooms Forget Breakfast its avg . lovely double tree cookies on checkin
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: Well-appointed accommodations.  3.5 star rating is spot on.  Definitely not an average hotel.  Very comfortable beds.  Nice bathrooms.  Hotel is either new or recently renovated.  Parking fee is an extra charge per night.  Great stay and would certainly go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel on a budget. I paid a very reasonable rate and it included the breakfast buffet. It had all the qualities I expected of a Hilton, with a very comfortable bed, pillows and linens. Having a very comfortable bed is number one in what I look for. Afterall, if you pay Motel 6 prices, what good is it if you wake up in agony from a terrible back ache from sleeping on a lousy bed? The second most important thing, is having breakfast included. It saves both money and time. The buffet breakfast was outstanding. Everything is fresh including the pancakes, waffles and french toast. These 3 items are difficult to keep from getting hard like a rock when it sits for a while. Every morning there were some new selections. The buffet had much to choose from. Eggs, sausage,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary Heading: At $175 per night a cookie just doesn't quite cut it
Summary: Ok so I realize that in a population exceeding 20 million people, hotels can afford to pick and choose the amenities they offer. And the “take it or leave it” attitude stems from the fact that if you don’t take the room someone else will. In fact that’s just what happened to me.   I took one look and one smell of the dark, dank, room that reeked of residual cigarette smoke, (See my review of the Candlewood Inn & Suites, Garden Grove, California), and I was soon out on the street looking for a decent hotel in the heart of Disneyland territory in the middle of July. “Good Luck,” says I. Everything was booked full. I needed 2 nights. After several stops and phone calls I happened on to a good reservations gal over the phone. She began searching hotels in the area and because I’m

Summary: Nice clean rooms,comfortable beds,cookies always good...digital channels on our flat screen went out,called downstairs. Found out just yesterday that all rooms were cancel d/t overbooking and also that previous manager did not follow policy and procedure.  So how is this my fault?  Anyway, I wouldn't recommend anyone to stay at this hotel b/c according to their new managers, Jay and Joe, they can cancel your reservation anytime they see fit b/c they have to keep an eye out for their company!!!!  They'll cancel the low rates quoted so they can charge the higher rates to newer reservations.  So be ware of this hotel!!  Personally, I will never stay at the Doubletree or Hilton ever again.

Summary: This hotel has a beautiful lobby and is very close to major highways....that's were the positives end.  I was shocked to see a $14.00 "overnight self-parking fee" tacked onto my bill when I checked out.  When we booked our room, we were not told about this charge.  They also tried adding $4.50 for a bottle of water we did not drink.  I got them to remove the charge for the bottle of water but they showed me a small sign behind the sign for the hotel shuttle that mentioned the $14.00 parking fee.    Our room was just o.k.   The a/c took a long time to cool the room down.  The furniture was a bit run-down---the springs were broken on the easy chair and you sank almost to the floor. Summary: I spend over 100 nights per year on the road and it used to be over 200 night a year so I know a good hotel and a bad hotel.   I stayed at this Double Tree for two nights (this week - so it's fresh in my mind) and it was a perfect stay. The room was normal size for a hotel, clean, very comfortable and I didn't here any noise from the surrounding area at all. Unlike some of the other post I didn't have any issues with how clean the hotel was, and they must have stopped charging for internet because I plugged in and it didn't ask for a room number or credit card (it's not wireless in the room but they do have a cable in the desk). Summary: This Double Tree was good overall, but the extra charges bring its grade down.  The computer system was down when I checked in, but the staff gave me a breakfast voucher for waiting.  The lobby and the rooms looked clean and new, and the rooms were surprisingly soundproof.    Pro:  Free cookies at check-in, clean rooms w/average amenities, clock radio with iPod jack, in-house breakfast.  Con:  $14 to park, $10 for Internet, $4 for bottled water, no real business center.  I'd be a lot less satisfied if I had to pay the full price for my room, but for $70 (Hotwire) it was pretty good.

Summary: This hotel has some problems with its housekeeping standards. On the way to the room there was litter in the hallways and lots of dishes left from room service outside of each door ( and this was at 3 pm in the afternoon). In the room itself there was pubic hair in the bathtub (ugh!).  At poolside there are 2 ( yes only two) loungechairs for the entire poolside.  There were ice machines in the hallway that had broken and leaked onto the carpet and everything on that floor was was musty. That all said, the check in/out folks were very nice and at 11 pm at night the barman made an extra trip into the kitchen to get me a glass of milk to go with my Double tree cookie. Summary Heading: Good of been better, average overall.
Summary: Stayed at this hotel last month for a wedding. Don't get this location confused with the Doubletree Club a block or so away.    With the bridal party, we walked up to the front desk with luggage, dresses, etc. in two. They don't necessarily have the brightest people working the front, there are a couple that are great, it's the other ones that I worry about. (For example, I handed the girl my credit card, and she asked me what my name was. Hmm...) The great thing is they give you a nice hot cookie when you register. Feel free to ask for more 'cuz they will give them to you.  Our hotel room was what you expected it would be. They give you Neutrogena toiletries, which are great. There's a bunch of different toiletries they can give you, so it depends on who makes up your room.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: Booked a room through Hotwire for $59+tax.  Parking fee was separate.  When we got the hotel late night we were told that there aren't any non-smoking rooms available.  The room that we got smelled like someone just smoked in there before we entered (me and my wife are both ex-smokers).  We had to call up hotel management to find an acceptable room.  At the end we asked to go through every vacant room to find one that doesn't smell too bad.  After a bit they ended up giving us another smoking room (that wasn't too bad). Other than that the hotel was good.  The room was comfortable.  The location was decent.  We had to park on the street because the garage was full (I guess hotel has agreements with local merchants to use their parking spots).

Summary: First off, I booked the room via Priceline at a great low price of $55/night during Memorial Day Weekend.  All the previous reviews are correct, there is a $14/parking charge.  I never complain about paying parking fees because the majority of hotels rated 3 stars and up charge this fee.  I'm used to it.  There was plenty of parking when I arrived around 5pm on Saturday, but when we decided to leave the hotel for dinner and came back around 10pm, parking became dire.  We drove around the lot for about 20 minutes and then I decided to call the hotel to ask if I could park in a handicapp spot...they said it was fine.  So, I agree that parking is a pain. Summary Heading: It's All Good -- Even the Annoying
Summary: Some of this hotel's problems are built-in.  First, it is at one of the noisiest street intersections in Orange County.  Second, the business estate where the hotel is located has much construction going forth.  Third, it is near the point where the 5, the 55, and the 405 freeways intersect.    If you stand in the parking lot and listen, you can hear a low-frequency roar from all the traffic.   The hotel itself is hemmed in on all sides with no room to expand.  That does make parking difficult .  If you come in late at night, finding parking might put you through some changes.     A very diverse clientele here. Summary: Stayed for one night on April 11, and this is just not a businessperson's hotel, period.  $239/night for a king is expensive; $14/night for parking is ridiculous; no free internet either in-room or in the lobby is just flat greedy ($9.95/day); no business center, only a couple of those cheesy computers with a printer that charges per sign-on to the internet and charges $.50/page for copies!!!; remote control for the TV did not work.  I've been HiltonHhonors Diamond VIP for years, and all I got was a coupon for a beer or a glass of wine and a coupon for the buffet breakfast.  Hampton Inn's have it all over this hotel; they get it...this Doubletree doesn't.

Summary: We got the Doubletree through Hotwire for one night for a quick trip to Disneyland. In our group were my wife, our one-year-old son, and myself.  Location: The Doubletree is super easy to find, a block away from the 55 freeway in Santa Ana. It took about 15 minutes to get to Disneyland from the hotel. We also drove to Newport Beach, which was about 10-15 minutes from the hotel as well. The area surrounding the hotel has a little downtown feel, as there are mostly tall business buildings. Most of the cafes and such were closed at night however.  Outside Appearance/Lobby: The hotel was spotless inside and out.  The lobby is very nice and elegant. Summary: I booked this hotel through Priceline- $60+ $14 or so for taxes and whatnot. We got there late, and yes, were suprised by the $12 parking, but pleasantly surprised by the room. The king bed was nice and firm, there were numerous pillows, and the towels were pretty nice. Check-in and check-out was fast and courteous. Another nice perk was that since we got there so late (around midnight) they let us have a late check-out: 2 PM. Considering we booked the room 1 day before, I have to say this was quite a nice place to stay for the deal we got through priceline.

Summary: We stayed here for one night and it was better than we had expected.  It was like your average hotel room but a little nicer. We got a good rate from Hotwire for $59/nt, $72 with tax and fees so it was definitely worth the value.  It was very clean and the bed was oh so comfortable.  There were 5 down pillows and a down comforter.  Right off the 55, so it was very convenient.  It says Santa Ana but it's more less Costa Mesa.  We were very pleased for the price we paid.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel and a great location!
Summary: I stayed one night on business last week and got a $68 rate from Hotwire.  Considering the Expedia rate was $190, I thought this was awesome.  Good location near John Wayne Airport and local business and easy to get in and out.  The parking was free on my trip, whereas other people have said it was $12.  An upscale apartment complex and small retail center (coffee, wines, nails, etc.) shares the property.  As for the rooms, I found a good-sized bathroom with great towels, nice toiletries, a great shower head and a granite lavatory, though the bed area itself was faily small.  The king-sized bed was soft (maybe an older mattress), but the linens were very new and I must have had 5-6 down pillows on the bed.  Check-in was quick and my wake-up call came right on time. Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and sharing your feedback.

Summary: Very nice place, was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the earlier negative reviews... nice bathrooms, comfortable beds, good size rooms. Pool a little on the small side but we only used it once so it was no big deal. Not far from the 5 highway and only about a 20 minute drive into Newport Beach. Would definitely stay here again in the future IF I could get the same rate off of Hotwire as I did this go around. Parking was easy and convenient and 12 bucks isn't really all that bad considering I paid 26 a night earlier this summer at the Omni in LA... Highly recommend.
